apis.short_description: List all fact values of a given host.

examples:
GET /api
200
{
  "links": {
    "List of domains": "/api/domains",
    "List all audits": "/api/audits",
    "List all puppetclasses": "/api/puppetclasses",
    "List all fact values": "/api/fact_values",
    "List all hosts": "/api/hosts",
    "List all roles": "/api/roles",
    "List all architectures": "/api/architectures",
    "List all settings": "/api/settings",
    "List all lookup_keys": "/api/lookup_keys",
    "Show available links": "/api",
    "List all bookmarks": "/api/bookmarks",
    "List all usergroups": "/api/usergroups",
    "List all reports": "/api/reports",
    "List all users": "/api/users",
    "List all smart_proxies": "/api/smart_proxies",
    "List all operating systems": "/api/operatingsystems",
    "List all authsource ldaps": "/api/auth_source_ldaps",
    "Get Dashboard results": "/api/dashboard",
    "List all media": "/api/media",
    "List all ptables": "/api/ptables",
    "List all hostgroups": "/api/hostgroups",
    "List of subnets": "/api/subnets",
    "List all compute resources": "/api/compute_resources",
    "Show status": "/api/status",
    "List templates": "/api/config_templates",
    "List all models": "/api/models",
    "List all environments": "/api/environments",
    "List all template kinds": "/api/template_kinds",
    "List all common parameters": "/api/common_parameters",
    "List all images for compute resource": "/api/compute_resources/:compute_resource_id/images"
  }
}

methods.name: create

domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are or the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

params.name: id

params.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

for example http://mirror.averse.net/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.
params.name: path

params.description:
The family that the operating system belongs to.

Available families:

  • Archlinux
  • Debian
  • Gentoo
  • Redhat
  • Solaris
  • Suse
  • Windows
params.name: os_family

params.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

for example http://mirror.averse.net/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.
params.name: path

params.description:
The family that the operating system belongs to.

Available families:

  • Archlinux
  • Debian
  • Gentoo
  • Redhat
  • Solaris
  • Suse
  • Windows
params.name: os_family
